channel.title: Long Posts on weeeblog
channel.description: Recent content in Long Posts on weeeblog

item.title: A Yucatecan Foodtrip
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: Disclaimer: All recommendations made in the blog are solely based on personal experiences. There are no affiliate links, and most of them will anyway take you to Google Maps. Shavak and I had been planning to meet all winter. It was turning out to be difficult because he was working out of Vancouver and I was studying in New York. Neither of us had visas to the other country.

item.title: Adversarial Attacks on RL Agents
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: This post a write up for the final project as part of NYU’s graduate course on Deep Reinforcement Learning. The project was the result of a collaboration with Advika Reddy. Outline Abstract Background What are Adversarial Attacks? How are they different for RL Agents? Types of Adversarial Attacks White-box Attacks Black-box Attacks Motivation How do the adversarial policies exploit the victim?

item.title: Building your first RNN
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: If you have some understanding of recurrent networks, want to get your hands dirty, but haven’t really tried to do that on your own, then you are certainly at the right place. This tutorial is a practical guide about getting started with recurrent networks using PyTorch. We’ll solve a simple cipher using PyTorch 0.4.0, which is the latest version at the time of this writing. Outline The Problem The Dataset Word Embeddings The Cipher The Dataset (Finally!
